name: Meatball-Stuffed Crescent Rolls
author: margsmil
summary: These ground turkey meatballs stuffed in crescent rolls are perfect appetizers for any party! They need a little extra time to make, but they are delicious!
ingredients: 1 envelope dry onion soup mix (such as Lipton®)
2 (8 ounce) packages refrigerated crescent roll dough (such as Pillsbury®
directions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Mix ground turkey with onion, onion soup mix, parsley, garlic, salt, and pepper
Form mixture into about 48 small meatballs
Open 1 package of crescent rolls, keeping the other refrigerated
Place a meatball in the middle of each, stretch and wrap the dough around it, and pinch to seal
Place stuffed rolls seam-side down onto one of the prepared cookie sheets
Repeat with the second roll of crescent dough and remaining meatballs
Brush egg wash over each roll
Bake in the preheated oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a meatball reads at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C), 20 to 25 minutes
